channel.title: The New Yorker — Reporting
channel.description: Latest reporting from The New Yorker

item.title: The Mysterious Cover Artist Who Captured the Decline of the Rich
item.description: Mary Petty was reclusive, uncompromising, but she peered into a fading world with unmatched warmth and brilliance.

item.title: Rivals Rub Shoulders in the World of Competitive Massage
item.description: Each year, massage therapists from around the globe gather to face off, collaborate, and make sure that no body gets left behind.

item.title: An Unrepressed Podcast Hosted by Freud’s Great-Granddaughter
item.description: Bella Freud—who’s also the child of Lucian—has had a lot to unpack. She’s working through it, mesmerizingly, on “Fashion Neurosis.”

item.title: Playing the Field with My A.I. Boyfriends
item.description: Nineteen per cent of American adults have talked to an A.I. romantic interest. Chatbots may know a lot, but do they make a good partner?

item.title: Enemies of the State
item.description: How the Trump Administration declared war on Venezuelan migrants in the U.S.

item.title: What I Wanted, What I Got
item.description: Lifelong lessons in yearning and style.

item.title: New Yorker Covers, Brought to Life!
item.description: To celebrate the magazine’s hundredth anniversary, photographers collaborated with Spike Lee, Julia Garner, Sadie Sink, and other notable figures to update covers from the archive.

item.title: Inside Uniqlo’s Quest for Global Dominance
item.description: The brand conceives of itself as a distribution system for utopian values as much as a clothing company. Can it become the world’s biggest clothing manufacturer?

item.title: How Jessica Reed Kraus Went from Mommy Blogger toMAHAMaven
item.description: The founder of “House Inhabit” has grown her audience during the second Trump Administration with political gossip and what she calls “quality conspiracy.”

item.title: Is the Sagrada Família a Masterpiece or Kitsch?
item.description: In the century since Antoni Gaudí died, his wild design has been obsessively realized, creating the world’s tallest church—and an endlessly debated icon.
